Name: Mathemagician
Description:
The tournament of the best Mathemagician is now initiated! In order to win the first prize: the legendary Book of Mathemagic, every mathemagician is well-prepared. Be ready for this challenge, doing whatever you can to beat other competitors and become the Master of Mathemagician!

Players will exchange their cards to form their card piles in gameplay. They can rely on the effect cards or their own judgment to achieve this goal. Meanwhile they’ll also use barriers to make their pinballs drop into right slot to get higher score, and avoid being disturbed by other competitors’ action. The key to win this game is by using your effect cards successfully and skillfully.

Name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – Underhand of the Emperor
Description:
Underhand of the Emperor contains 78 new cards (three copies of 25 different cards and 1 copy of each of 3 different cards). Underhand of the Empire expands on classic themes of the Scorpion, giving them new deck building options that encourages them to toe the line between dishonor and defeat. Look for a new Role card, a Philosophy that prevents you from losing the game, and an army of whispers, standing at attention.

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Daifugo Game
Description:
This is not card game!
This is a big size board game!

A game aiming to become a billionaire.
Your luck and your judgment ability are tried.

You start the game on a bicycle.
Turn the roulette and advance work, earn money by working part-time at the stop point.
Next, choose whether to purchase a car or purchase insurance with money.
You finally purchase a limousine car and go to another route.
If you buy a company, you gain a profit.
Once you acquire a share certificate, you can acquire a company of another company.
Ultimately, I will buy a cruiser and buy an island in Hawaii. If you acquire a private jet and establish an overseas branch in a city around the world you can earn more profit.
In Hawaii you can challenge to find the treasure of a sinking ship.
In Las Vegas you can challenge the casino.
Going abroad has the opportunity to gain great profit, but there is a possibility of failure.
By going around the domestic flight, you can get a small and stable profit.
You need to choose either.

Finally, the Space Shuttle will be launched at $ 10,000.
When someone built the space station, the game is over.
After the game, the richest player will be the winner.

Name: DreamQuest: L'épouvanpaille
Description:
Dreamquest is an invitation to create with your kid a customized book in wich you are the story's characters, but not any of those!
From an adventure notebook, you decide which paths to take and what challenge to deal with. The game system is based on cards that allows the players to solve different challenges.

Once the adventure is finished, you can record and personalize your story in a few clics on the website Elixeer. Abra-cada-bra, you'll receive YOUR novel within a few days.

Elixeer is offering a wonderful experience to get generations of players along and develop the taste of books to children, by mixing gaming and reading.

Dreamquest is a 2 players game, as from 5 years old and for games of about 30 minutes

------- French -------

Dreamquest vous invite à créer avec votre enfant un livre personnalisé dont vous êtes les acteurs de l’histoire, mais pas n’importe laquelle !   A partir d’un carnet d’aventure, vous décidez ensemble des chemins à prendre et épreuves à affronter. Un système de jeu coopératif à base de cartes permet de résoudre les différents défis.

Une fois l’aventure terminée, vous enregistrez et personnalisez votre histoire en quelques clics sur le site Elixeer. Abracadabra, vous recevez VOTRE roman quelques jours plus tard.

Elixeer propose une formidable expérience pour rapprocher les générations et développer le goût du livre chez les enfants, mélangeant le jeu et la lecture.

Dreamquest se joue à 2, à partir de 5 ans pour des parties de 30 minutes environ.

Name: Nemesis: Aftermath & Void Seeders
Description:
Nemesis: Aftermath & Void Seeders is an expansion for Nemesis. It contains all of the stretch goals from the Kickstarter campaign except for Medic: the Aftermath expansion and the Void Seeders expansion.
—user summary

"Every spaceship has a voice; a melody of machinery and subsystems its crew learns intimately during long travels. The problem is, ever since the last mission our ship sounds WRONG. There’s something foul in the way it’s speaking to us. Barely audible murmurs. Strange whispers no machine could make. The dark corridors and vast halls almost seem to SING.

Some of us have tried to locate sources of this interferences, but they always seemed two steps ahead. Stalked by their never-ending presence, we soon started cracking. Our engineer has cut some words on his flesh. When we asked why, he replied:‘Incandescent secrets need to be written in blood’. Then, our navigator took a spacewalk without her suit. When we pulled her in, her entire face frozen and cracked, she grinned in a way I will never forget.

Now, it got even worse. Noises turned into voices, sharing tales of slaughter and terror. They do not run from us anymore. They encircle us and herd us through the ship to some dark purpose. I need to UNDERSTAND them before it’s too late. I put my hand on the pistol grip, looking at the backs of my last two crewmembers. I see dark mysteries swirling under their skulls. It would only take two bullet holes to release them..."

Rules:

Overlook:

Voidseeders are a race that can interact with the minds of crew members. They will have few nests instead of one, but only one strong fighting presence at given moment. Once killed, new one will be awakened from the most developed nest.

This race will focus on whispering and controlling minds - people who will be near them will start to hear voices commanding them to do different destructive things.

Nests:

On the board, there is normally 1 Nest as a room token, but there are additionally 2-3 smaller nests. Those are places where new Voidseeders will born. At the moment of discovering main Nest, you should put a Stalker miniature in it (this is the model that is on the ship from the beginning. He is very dangerous, especially when faced by people with a high Insanity level).

Other Nests will start showing up on the board together with discovering certain Exploration tokens. Those nests will be especially dangerous. They will not move, but if a crew member will happen to end the turn at the tile with a nest, he will get a serious wound.

Voidlurkers

They will spawn in nests, and their objective will be to spread insanity and try to move players to Nests.

Whispersers

They will work very similar to Voidlurkers, but with the difference that they will have the main goal of defending the main nest.

Stalker

He is a main guardian. He takes advantage from fear / insanity of the crew members and will focus on them.

Despoiler

Equivalent of the Queen. Actually, it is hard to say if she is real or if it is a mass hallucination. One way or the other, she will only emerge when all Insanity tokens are on players (number of tokens will be specific for different numbers of players). She is extremely strong.

Contamination card

Here it will change a little bit - players will normally get a contamination card every time they will get an insanity token. They will be easier to discard (you don't need to check if it was infected or not). Effect of the card will only take place at the very end of the game, and it will be the same as in the normal version - if it will turn out it was indeed "infected," it will mean that your character, even if escaped, went mad and lost the game either way.

Whispers mechanic

This mechanism will change the noise mechanic. Whenever you move (or an event card will tell you to), you will need to roll for whispers. If you would get a corridor with an whisper token already in it (you hear something more) - you need to draw a Card from the Insanity deck. Those cards will apply to you or not based on the numbers of insanity tokens your character has. Effects might be very different - from one-time action to permanent disabilities.

Combat

In combat, Voidlurkers will only try to add insanity tokens to you and then run away to the closes nest. Whisperers will be harder to kill, as well as present some portion of actual physical danger, but their main weapon will still be giving you insanity tokens.

Things will change with Stalker and Despoiler - those two will be huge opponents who will give you real wounds, so you will not want to be near them.

Event phase

In the event phase, one additional step that will be added is checking your insanity tokens and numbers of Voidlurkers and Whisperers in all rooms next to yours. If the number of them is higher than the number of insanity tokens, you add one insanity token and draw one contamination card.

But whenever you will be in a room with other people, this effect will be less harmful. (they can help you calm down)

Overall feel

Overall feel we will be going for will be way different from what you will have in the base Core Box. We have a lot of cool ideas how to get Insanity cards in a way, that it will be an additional layer of you not trusting your friends  - not only because of their objective but perhaps because of the Insanity cards.

Additionally, interaction with Voidseeders will be way different, you will need to think very carefully where to move or place your hero to not go insane.

—description from the publisher

Name: BoxiTale: Knights of Nature
Description:
BoxiTale brings stories to life on smartphones or tablets, allowing children to craft their innovative skills on a gameboard. Utilizing the BoxiTale app while building the game, players design, build and solve challenges presented to them within the story.

Boxitale is a table top game that uses a smartphone/ tablet to stream an animated series taking place in a secret land called “El Animal” where Alen, Drama and the kids (players) are part of a group called ‘knights of nature’.

The group meets regularly in their hiding place at the treehouse, but something strange happens. A book starts to move on the book shelf, and they find themselves in the mystical land, “El- Animal”, where evil forces take control of the animal powers.

The kids use various crafted technics and a lot of imagination and creativity to solve the challenges and save “El Animal".

Name: Bears vs Lumberjacks!
Description:
Bears vs Lumberjacks is an light, fast-paced 2-3 player micro card game. It takes around 10-15 minutes to play and only seconds to learn. It's a card laying game relying on how and where you place your cards.

The goal is to end the round with the most points.  The round ends when all 18 cards have been played. The first player to win 2 rounds will be victorious! There are four cards in each deck that contain a scoring icon. Points are awarded when your numbers on the cards played are touching your scoring icon. If a point is touching more then 1 scoring icon you get that point for each scoring icon.

HOW TO PLAY
You must play 1 card on your turn. All cards have values in the 4 corners.
You must play your card on top of another players as long as your number is higher. The first player each round will play a card to start the round.
4 cards have scoring icons. The scoring icons have no point value but can cover any number! However, the scoring icons cannot be covered.
You CAN’T play over your own cards, 2 corners, or 2 cards. You can only cover 1 number at a time.

-description from designer

Name: Bones of the Caribbean
Description:
Bones of the Caribbean is a small format, competitive game for 2-5 players in which you play as pirates vying for the most reputation by raiding islands, burying treasure, stealing plunder, navigating storms, and attacking rivals. The ultimate scourge takes the prize of the seas.

The game uses "take that" and press-your-luck mechanisms. You roll to take actions, but pressing your luck might cause you to get scurvy. Every result allows you to interact with another player in some fashion, whether you're digging up a rival's treasure, attacking their ship or island, plundering the sea, causing storms to damage other ships, or creating a mutiny on someone's ship. Along the way, you'll score points for building ships, hiring a crew, taking plunder, burying treasure, and winning combat.

Name: Smuggler
Description:
The object of the game is to smuggle two bails of contraband from the "Mother Ship" and then proceed to land without being busted.

Each player selects a speedboat and corresponding color course to represent his/hervoyage across the board. There are three marked zones across the playing board. Each zone has both an eastern and western color course. Each zone should contain 2 stacks of corresponding game cards, marked EAST and WEST, placed face down on their allowed geographical spaces. There should be a total of 6 stacks of game cards on the playing board.

THE PLAY... Play begins with each player rolling die. Highest roll starts from Florida coast first. Second highest goes next and so forth. Speedboats progress across the board according to the roll of the die. When a player lands on a space marked X he/she must pick a game card form the corresponding zone and comply with the requirements before returning card to bottom of respective stack. Players are to draw NO MORE than one card per turn.

MOTHER SHIP & YOU'RE BUSTED... "Mother Ship" counts as one space to board and load. After reaching the "Mother Ship" each player must decide upon the quantity ( 1 or 2 bales) he wishes to load. The quantity of the load decides the degree of risk. If a player carrying 1 bale back to Florida draws a "You're Busted" card he/she must replace the bale back on the "Mother Ship", return his/her speedboat to start in Florida and try again. Two busts and player is out of the game. A player who risks to smuggle 2 bales on one trip back to Florida is automatically out of the game upon drawing a "You're Busted" card. (Exception see Pay Off Cards). The first player who successfully smuggles 2 bales back to Florida either on one trip or several is the winner.

PAY OFF CARDS... When a player draws a "Pay Off Card" he/she should keep it for use when busted. After it is used return it to the bottom of the deck.

Name: Toke Up
Description:
Go up and down the leaf, following the arrows and instructions on the cards that you receive from landing on their respective spaces. You must get all the way to the end of the leaf (without passing out). The first person to who lands on the "100 Kilo" space with an exact roll wins 100 Kilos. This stops all play and everyone counts up how many kilos they have. The person with the most kilos wins the game.

—user summary

Name: K-Chess
Description:
To play K-Chess you need a box of 8 K-Drons (4 each of 2 colors) and a regular chessboard.

There are only five (5) different types of pieces involved in this game:  pawns, knights, bishops, rooks and queens (no king).

The object of the game is to capture the opponent’s figures using all the chess rules of movement.  Each player has four (4) pawns at the start of the game located on the corresponding color square of the first row.

At each turn the player can either move a piece or transform it into another on (up or down the scale) according to the following sequence (scale):  pawn-knight-bishop-rook.  Pawn can be transformed into queens by crossing the board to the opponents starting row.

Name: Oracles Game: Civil War
Description:
Oracles Game is a 2 to 10 player, team-oriented, combat strategy board game with augmented reality feature, designed to work with its exclusive free mobile application to elevate board game to a whole new level. Players will split into two teams, choose a leader on each side and start the game with the goal to occupy the enemy’s tavern.
 On their journey, players will face obstacles, mystery chests, dragons, sea monsters and dark forest creatures challenging them for their lives. Your leader, using the included augmented reality mobile application, will guide you through the dangers of the game and into victory.

Name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Queenie 13: Map
Description:
Queenie 13 for Escape. 1 new chamber.

New chamber “Map”

Once discovered, a player inside the map chamber can roll 2 torch symbols to place his adventurer in any other already discovered chamber of his choice.

Name: Orcs Vs Vikings
Description:
Orcs Vs. Vikings is a 2-4 player worker placement game where players will have to work together to gather the resources they need to build defenses around their village. The Orcs are attacking from the mountains and your tiny Viking Village doesn't have the amount of villagers needed to fight them off. Help is on the way but it will still be days until help arrives! You must fight off the invading Orcs while trying to build your defenses. Work together to strategically hold them off until help arrives!

Players will take turns in order by sending out the villagers they control to several of the locations on the board. Such locations as the Blacksmith, Odin's Temple, The Market or even the outskirts of town (like the Forest, Mines or the Quarry). You will have to collect the resources needed to build defenses. Once the players have placed their Villagers on the board, Orcs will arrive! Now in the same turn order, players will activate their Villagers to either collect those resources, trigger an action, contribute to a defense, or fight off an Orc! If 10 villagers die, you lose. If your village gets overrun, you lose. If you get all 4 of your defenses built, YOU WIN!

-description from designer

Name: DinoPark
Description:
You’ve heard the stories, seen the movies, but now the chance is yours to create history.  For nearly 200 years, humanity has been fascinated by dinosaurs, ever since the first unearthing in Oxfordshire, England.  From the mid 19th Century onwards, dinosaur discoveries were made around the world, on every continent and the rush was on.

Throughout all of this, fossils were uncovered and with these bones, scientists were able to recreate the look and properties of these “Terrible Lizards” for all to see in museums.  This was the closest that we were ever able to walk amongst these creatures – until now.
    
    Through ground breaking use of recreating DNA, scientists have been able to bring these creatures back from their millions of years of extinction.  Theme parks are now being built for every man, woman and child to gaze upon these animals in their natural habitat.  You have been tasked to design the ultimate dinosaur theme park with the hopes of it becoming the World’s Most Incredible Theme Park!

Through two Eras, you will be tasked with drafting cards to build a Dinosaur Theme Park.  By strategically placing Herbivores and Carnivores around your park, you will attempt to outscore your opponents by collecting Victory Points (VP).  However, dinosaurs alone will not be enough to win the game.  Attractions and Rides will need to be built to increase your income, and you’ll need to build around the natural geography that your park is built upon.  Oh, and let’s not forget about security, otherwise all those people you are bringing into your park may not be able to make it out and let others know how incredible your park is.

-description from designer

Name: Dogtag
Description:
Dogtag is the casual party game set in a world where dogs seek online fame by posting to their social media app, Dogtag. Born from LA pet pop culture, Dogtag is a heckin’ cute card game with a bucketload of dog puns, and a ton of personality.

The goal of Dogtag is to become the top dog. Test your social suave by curating your profile with picture cards and strategically placing comment cards on other dogs’ pics to climb the social ladder.

To win, earn three achievements cards that are laid out in the beginning of the game, drawn from the Achievement deck. One at a time, players take their two-phased turn to populate their profile with pictures and comments in the hopes that these cards satisfy the Achievement requirements. Dogs need to be very smart with their posts, as other players can make you go viral as quick as they can make your profile spiral.

Name: Ouroboros: Eternal Struggle
Description:
The cards themselves change every round.  Constantly changing tactical card play that can be cruel, yet just.  This is a mystical ecosystem card game where managing your hand and board is challenged by ever-changing cards.

Players are simply playing cards either for effect (Spells), or to Store for later use.  Be it Points and Carry-Over abilities (Boons), or Negative Points played on others (Curses)

Name: Quorum I
Description:
Quorum I can be played by two to six players. It represents a typical business corporation consisting of different levels of management. The objective of the game is to see which player will eventually attain the highest level of management - the Presidency! The first player to reach the Presidency and successfully obtain a dice score of seven is considered the winner, and the game is over. Quorum I is a game of chance and involves the tossing of two dice. As in any corporation, a player is subject to promotion, demotion, layoff, transfer, suspension, reprimand, and even dismissal.

—description from the publisher

Name: So Long, My World: Eclipse of My Soul
Description:
"Have you... have you ever thought that the word soul is pronunciated like..."

Eclipse of my Soul expands the gameplay with Neurosis Cards and Psychosis Cards.

Neurosis Cards are drafted at the beginning of each game, giving you a particular power that will distinguish you from the other players. Psychosis Cards will be obtained if players are banking too many feeling tokens, giving them dangerous effects. 
These cards will become relevant for the Karma Chains as well.

Like Remnants of the Moon and Wells of the Sun, Eclipse of My Soul is fully compatible with all game modes.

Name: Kokomots
Description:
Check the themes and compose related words.

• launch the hourglass (in fact, just turn it)
• pick up a theme
• find a word related to this theme, using the letters in your hand and on the grid

If hourglass still not empty, try to find another word for another theme.

Name: Knights of King Arthur
Description:
Knights of King Arthur is an adventure game for two or more players -- played with miniature figures -- which simulates the heroic combat of the Age of Chivalry. Here is a realistic game in which you lead an army of knights and men-at-arms as they pit sword against shield in a struggle for the throne of medieval England. It is your skill and strategy which will determine the outcome.

Knights of King Arthur is a simplified version of Heritage's Knights and Magick gaming system. This set is your introduction to the world of Adventure Gaming with miniature figures -- then as your interests and abilities grow, you can add to the set with extra figures from the Knights and Magick line and begin playing with the extra features in the advanced Knights and Magick Rules Set.

—description from the publisher

A Knights and Magick series game from Heritage USA's Paint 'N' Play line. The Paint 'N' Play games all feature Heritage miniatures along with paints and painting instructions. Knights of King Arthur also includes miniatures rules that allow you to fight out battles directly on the tabletop.

Additional contents include 14 metal miniature figures, paints, brush, "gaming die," and a painting guide. Heritage sold additional 25mm "fantasy-historical" metal figures that could be used with the series games.

—user summary
Families: Theme: King Arthur / The Knights of the Round Table / Camelot

Name: Fight Club: The Home Game
Description:
DO NOT READ THIS

If you have not read or watched FIGHT CLUB , the primary essential secret is revealed below. You can still safely click away now and remain spoiler free. Still here? Whatever then. Here Goes...

In Fight Club, the depressed and sleep-deprived "Narrator" invents Tyler Durden as his idealized "superman," representing everything The Narrator wants to be: strong, confident, bold. But Tyler Durden is also selfish, cruel, and emotionally sterile. The very essence of chaos.

Fight Club: The Home Game is a two person competitive deck-builder between Tyler Durden and The Narrator. Tyler and The Narrator share, build, destroy, sabotage, and enhance the same deck. Tyler wins by destroying cards and completing Project Mayhem. The Narrator wins by buying very stylish collections of FÜRNI home décor and allowing his burgeoning emotional connection with Marla to flourish.

Will order find a way or will chaos reign? That's up to you. It's time to enter the high-stakes basement arena of Fight Club: The Home Game and find out.

Name: Time of Legends: Joan of Arc – Compendium
Description: This hardback book contains several distinct sections. The aim is to give a mix of things to read and look at, to make, and to play. The main sections are: Art, Background, Miniatures Gallery, Painting Guide, Terrain Guide and Campaign.
Families: Game: Time of Legends – Joan of Arc

Name: Time of Legends: Joan of Arc – Siege
Description:
This box includes a whole huge castle, loads of siege engines, more terrain, more miniatures, and a whole new way to expand your games called the Siege card game.

The Siege card game simulate weeks of watching and waiting, punctuated by stealthy raids and underhanded tricks. During the game, units on the table will gain ground and move to new positions, get sick and be moved to the out of combat section of the battle board, or even die from the plague. New units may join the besiegers, or sneak through the lines to reinforce the defence. New siege equipment can be built, and can start to batter down the walls. All this quickly replicates the effects of weeks of preparations. After these preparations, you play out the Final Assault.

The Final Assault is played as a normal game of Time of Legends: Joan of Arc. Capturing or holding the many sections of the castle, along with casualties, determine whether attacker or defender can claim victory.
Families: Game: Time of Legends – Joan of Arc

Name: Tanks: Churchill Tank Expansion
Description:
From the package insert back:

Designed to be protected against any anti-tank gun in existence, the Churchill proved nigh on unstoppable in battle, shrugging off hits from German anti-tank guns and climbing terrain the Germans thought impassable to tanks.

This pack contains:
1x Unassembled Churchill tank
1x Churchill tank card
1x Churchill CS tank card
1x Hero card
2x Crew cards
2x Upgrade cards

Name: Tanks: Valentine Tank Expansion
Description:
From the package insert back:

The Valentine was designed as an infantry support tank. Armed with a light 2 pdr gun and plenty of armour it could shrug off hits that would knock out other tanks of a similar size. The Valentines of 23 Armoured Brigade crossed North Africa on their own tracks, fighting all the way.

This pack contains:
1x Unassembled Valentine tank
1x Valentine tank card
1x Valentine (Early) tank card
1x Valentine (Late) tank card
1x Hero card
2x Crew cards
2x Upgrade cards

Name: Micro Fleet: World War I – British Jutland Fleet
Description: New counters and tables to add the British Jutland Fleet to Micro Fleet: World War I

Name: Micro Fleet: World War I – German Jutland Fleet
Description: New counters and tables to add the German Jutland Fleet to Micro Fleet: World War I.

Name: Pimple Pete
Description:
Pimple Pete is a children's dexterity game in which players must extract pimples from a patient's plastic head.

Each player takes turns spinning the spinner. The arrow will land on one of four places: Pete's forehead, left cheek, right cheek, or chin. The number of points a player earns for extracting each pimple depends on the level of difficulty.

If a player pulls a pimple the wrong way as Pete's head rocks back and forth too much, the big "mega zit" on his nose blasts you with water.

Name: Kuflinyomozók
Description:
A cooperative children's game using the popular theme of "kuflik" (amorph, more or less bean-shaped creatures in Hungarian kids' books). Each play starts with a story - one of the "kufli"s loses something (there are 16 stories included in the box) and players have to find out which creature of the meadow took it. For this they walk around the meadow, trying to find certain creatures (shown on face-down tiles) that remember something about the animal (like "It didn't have fur... I'm allergic to fur and I wasn't sneezing."). After four main features are known, players find out who the thief is and try to remember where that thief is on the board. If they succeed, they've won!

3 game variants are included in the box:
- from age 3: no memory element - tiles that have been turned up remain face-up
- from age 4: cooperative play
- from age 6: competitive play with players holding certain creatures' cards in hand, sometimes drawing from each other and trying to have the thief in hand in the end.

Name: Out of ConTXT: Geek Deck
Description:
Reveal a card with a suggestion and then find the best answer on your phone. Use you texts, photos, song titles, whatever it takes to win. If you've got the funniest answer, you win the card. Get enough cards and you win the game.

A Comic Con exclusive.

Name: Out of ConTXT: Raucous Caucus
Description:
A stand alone expansion for Out of ConTXT.

Reveal a card with a suggestion and then find the best answer on your phone. Use you texts, photos, song titles, whatever it takes to win the State and all important electoral votes. Get enough votes and you win!

Name: Fallout: New California
Description:
Ah, California: sunshine, ocean breezes, and radioactive wasteland as far as the eye can see. This desolate coastal state was once a shining jewel, but since the Great War, the region known as New California has fallen into chaos — which is great news because where there's chaos, there's loot!

The Fallout: New California expansion brings new quests, companions, vaults, and items to Fallout: The Board Game, letting you venture out into the wasteland as five new characters. While there, you can wander across twelve new map tiles that expand the scenarios found in the original game or head into sunny New California and visit some of the most memorable locations from throughout the Fallout series.

—description from publisher's website

(Note: Miniatures are not pre-painted)

Name: Warhammer Underworlds: Shadespire – Shattered City Board Pack
Description:
New arenas to fight in with new terrain elements.

Expand and enhance your games of Warhammer Underworlds: Shadespire with this double-sided board section. Using the same hex-tiled layout as the other available boards, the Shattered City Board Pack introduces lethal terrain – attack your enemies and knock them back into sinister soul-traps, or deadly pools of bubbling magma! These lethal hexes can completely change the way in which players approach games of Shadespire; suddenly, cards that may have been overlooked can become the linchpin of your deck, and shoving an opponent into a soul-trap can be even more satisfying than capturing that final objective…

This board is the same dimensions as that provided in the Warhammer Underworlds: Shadespire game. Rules for using lethal terrain are included.

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer Underworlds: Shadespire – Leaders
Description:
Introduce a further layer of tactical depth and complexity to your games of Warhammer Underworlds by adding this deck to your card library. It contains 60 new cards – 20 ploy cards, 20 objective cards and 20 upgrade cards – with a focus on the leaders of your warbands. Each card affects the leader in some way, with many restricted to leader-only – this can entirely change the way you play, giving your leader some impressive advantages, and exploiting any weakness in your enemy’s leader you can find!

44 of the cards are universal, usable by any warband, with 16 warband-specific cards – 2 each for Magore’s Fiends, Sepulchral Guard, Ironskull’s Boyz, The Chosen Axes, Spiteclaw’s Swarm, Steelheart’s Champions, The Farstriders and Garrek’s Reavers.

—description from the publisher

Name: Campaign of Nations
Description:
With games like Objective Shreveport! and Hood's Last Gamble, designer John Theissen has found a unique, accessible, streamlined approach to games of operational maneuver. With Campaign of Nations, he turns his attention to the Napoleonic era, and specifically to the dramatic and turbulent 1813 Leipzig campaign. Waterloo might get the attention and the catchy pop song, but it was Leipzig that saw the emperor encircled, defeated, and forced to abdicate.

These are far larger, grander armies than those that marched across your plexi in Mr. Theissen's ACW games. New Zone of Control rules appropriate for this scale make it more difficult to slip by the enemy. Just before being attacked, defenders in multiple hexes may attempt to concentrate forces, leading to dramatic swings in fortune. These and other rules support a tense board situation in which the French player, occupying a central position, must contend with enemy armies marching in from all directions. Will Napoleon defeat each one in detail, or will they be able to tighten the noose?

Name: Desolate: Dark Matters Pack 1
Description:
Dark Matters Pack 1 is an 18 card booster expansion for the critically acclaimed solo game Desolate. You will need a copy of Desolate to use this booster.

What comes in Dark Matters Pack 1?

2 Exploration Cards - The Sanctuary and Cold Storage introduce an all-new affliction mechanic.

3 Conflict Cards - These nasty new conflict cards also can cause you to gain an affliction.

4 Affliction Cards - These cards cause the player to suffer from a phobia. Each phobia messes with the game mechanics in a unique way.

3 Character Cards - Character cards are optional cards that add theme and help set a difficulty level for play.

5 Item Cards - New items to increase the replay level of the game and add some twists.

1 Setup Card - A simple instruction card to explain the new cards in detail.

Name: Desolate: Dark Matters Pack 2
Description:
Dark Matters Pack 2 is an 18 card booster expansion for the critically acclaimed solo game Desolate. You will need a copy of Desolate to use this booster.

What comes in Dark Matters Pack 2?

2 Exploration Cards - The Warehouse allows players to find items and the Dark Passage depletes your oxygen levels.

3 Conflict Cards - These nasty new conflict cards up the difficulty level.

1 Shuttle Card - Use the Shuttle card to store power cells as you locate them in the station.

4 Character Cards - Character cards are optional cards that add theme and help set a difficulty level for play.

7 Item Cards - New items to increase the replay level of the game and add some twists.

1 Setup Card - A simple instruction card to explain the new cards in detail.

-description from designer

Name: Empire Strikes: Battle of Hungary in 1945
Description: Empire Strikes: Battle of Hungary in 1945 is a two-player game of the Siege of Budapest.

Name: The Bear: Russo-Georgian War in 2008
Description:
The Bear: Russo-Georgian War in 2008 is a two-player wargame about the 2008 Russo-Georgian war in South Ossetia.

One player plays the Russian army, the other the Georgian army.

One turn represents 6 hours during the day or 12 hours at night. 
one hex is equivalent to 1.5 km

Name: Hero Bridge: Battle of Northeast China in 1931
Description: Hero Bridge is a two-player game of the Resistance at Nenjiang Bridge during the Invasion of Manchuria in 1931.

Name: Vagrant Dash
Description:
Vagrant Dash is a 2 player tactical combat game, pitting 2 companies of struggling space vagrants against each other, trying to lay claim to the ancient derelict cities that they had found on a desert planet.

Featuring cute miniatures of tanks and aircraft, Vagrant Dash offers easy to understand gameplay, but with in-depth tactics that satisfy even the most veteran strategy gamer.

—description from the designer

Name: Landleven spel
Description:
Every player produces farm products and tries to sell them as well as possible. The more products of a kind a player has on his player table, the higher is the reward from the 'harvest'. Unfortunately, however, a player is often forced to sell his product at dump prices too early. And sometimes a harvest yields nothing at all. The aim of the game is to earn the most coins from the trade in farm products.

During the game, you grow vegetables and farm animals on your fields to earn coins. Each player starts with a hand of random produce cards. Each card has a picture of the product, cow, sheep, cabbage, sunflower etc, and numbers showing how many cards of that type you need to harvest at a time to get that amount of coins. You are not allowed to change the order of the cards in your hand. You play them in that order – unless you can trade them to other players, which is an essential part of the game.
During your turn you place one or two cards on your two fields in front of you, indicated on your personal play board. During the game you can buy a third field for your use. Each field can produce only one product – sheep, pumpkins etc. If you do not have space to do the required action of placing a product on your fields, you must harvest a field to make room for the new arrival. More cards on the field, more coins while harvesting.
Next, you take two cards from the deck and place them open on the table. You can take these cards for your own fields, or you can trade them or give them away – if anyone takes them. You can also trade cards from your hand, but all trading has to be done with the player in turn. No traded cards go back to hand. They all must be played to the fields after trading phase.
Finally, you take three and place them in the back of your hand. In the order you draw them.
The game ends when the draw pile has been used up for the third time. Who ever has the most coins wins.

Name: Skirmish Action
Description:
This set of WWII skirmish rules covers 1939-1945 with major unit Army Lists for German, US, Soviet, British, French, Polish, Italian, and Japanese forces, complete with point system for tournament games.

It includes variable initiative using cards (including command and control decision making), streamlined cover and concealment rules, streamlined sighting rules, vehicles, artillery, aircraft, scenario suggestions, and a d6 system with a single clever combat results table for infantry, vehicles, and guns. Optional rules cover vehicle crew bail out, slow turret traverse, ambushes, mines, night battles, massed targets, and more. Includes sample historical TO&Es, markers, and web support.

For Flames of War players, Skirmish Action includes adaptation for multiple figures per base.

—description from the designer

Name: Cheer Up!
Description:
Cheer Up! is a party game where players use adjective, noun, and verb cards to answer questions in the best way possible.

Each turn, the judge will flip over a question card, and the other players draw cards from the required deck(s). Using these cards, they answer the question in the funniest, best, or worst way possible, and the judge picks the combination they like the best.

Rule cards change up the game by adding absurd instructions for players to follow when reading out their card combinations.

Name: Kilo
Description:
The object of the game is to go out and by landing directly on one of many slightly shady establishments on the board, score one kilo of stash. In case you have forgotten, that is 35 lids. Should you go to jail you lose all of the lids you are carrying that are not safe. You lose 2 turns but can go free by rolling doubles on either throw or by paying $50 immediately.

You may go out and return home as many times as pessary, each time you return home you get an additional $75.00 and all the lids you are carrying are Safe. You may attempt to score your kilo in one trip around the board and return home, winning the game. But remember, anyone landing on the same space as you may take one of your lids you are carrying.

After landing directly on the scoring place, the price of your lids is determined by retooling the dice and paying the number rolled for each lid. You may purchase all or part of the number of lids listed for that scoring establishment.

Name: Tark Naine Taskus
Description:
Tark Naine Taskus is similar to Tark Mees Taskus but instead of categories there are different word games on one side of the cards and letters on another side.
E.g. players must form sentences where all words start with the same letter from the top card or make a poem where each verse start with the same letter.
For some cards need you to be the quickest, other cards need creativity.

If the deck is exhausted the player with the most cards is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Brain Quest Card Game: Grades 3 & 4
Description: BRAIN QUEST card game comes with two decks. The Questions deck is like a normal deck of playing cards with the addition of 4 trivia questions on them. These can be used to play variants of Rummy, Solitaire, or Go Fish (instructions included.) The Game Deck is used only with the BRAIN QUEST card game in which players draw from the Game Deck to get instructions on how to play their Questions cards. The first player to get rid of his or her cards wins.

Name: Trilobite: Family Game
Description:
Trilobite is an educational game repeating a half billion years of marine evolution.

One to three players design an animal genotype set in the ocean of 500million years ago.  Another player known as the “Mariner,” controls the trilobites, ammonites, plesiosaurs and other animals indigenous to the era.

The genotypes must survive the great radiation of life called the Cambrian explosion, as well as the Permian mass extinctions, and the Cretaceous event that exterminated the dinosaurs.

The genotypes evolve and metamorphose as they eat the marine animals they encounter.

—description from the publisher

Name: Stages: Can you win a Grand Tour Bicycle Race?
Description:
Welcome to the world of Grand Tour Bicycle Racing !

Stages is a 2 - 4 player card game where players battle for the Leader's Yellow Jersey by assembling teams of bikes racers in hopes of winning the most stages.

As the Sports director of the team, you are in charge of choosing which stages you are going to battle for with the team you have assembled.

There are 5 types of rides :
    "The Captain", these are the leaders of the pack and their peddling for the podium.
    "The Sprinter", these speed demons are winners of flat stages when top speed is on the line.
    "The Climber", when the race heads into the mountains, you need the lungs of a yak, the speed of a mountain lion.
    "The Domestique", eveybody needs help and these self-sacrificing riders are there to support their team by any and all means possible.
    "The Super-Domestique", the ride able to morph into any rider when the time calls on them and thus the wild card. 
    
Each of the 21 stages has a different profile suiting a different type of team. A stage takes anywhere from 1 - 5 riders to accomplish the stage. Every stage has points for the Leader's Yellow jersey and can have additional points toward the Sprinter's Leader Jersey with green points or red points towards the Climber's Leader's Polkadot Jersey.

However you can Crash Out of a stage or have teammates Traded to Other Teams.

Stage by stage and step by step battles ensue with the various jersey's changing hands until the final 21st Stage is completed and the winner is declared by holding the final Leader's Yellow Jersey.

Stages consists of 130 beautifully designed larger Tarot Card size (70mm x 121mm, 2.75" x 4.75") made of 300gsm professional quality card stock with a wonderful smooth finish.

With Hours of Play Testing, we Have Made Stages Easy to Learn and Quick to Play Taking Only About 30 Minutes for a Full Game.

You can simply build your team for the Current Stage or you can carefully plan your next few moves while you building your team for the more difficult upcoming stages. With stages, you can play with as little or as much strategy as you want to put in it. Whether you are 6 or 106, everyone will have fun collecting riders and winning stages.

—description from the designer

Name: The Noisavni Invasion
Description:
The Noisavni Invasion is a light, science fiction skirmish game for two players. It consists of eight scenarios that can be played individually or linked together in a campaign telling the story of a conflict between identical mecha forces across mirrored dimensions. With only two pages of rules, it’s ideal for both inexperienced wargamers and seasoned veterans who want to have a series of quick, fun battles.

Players drive the action through a strategic hand-management system that gives them partial control over the order in which units activate - both their own and the enemy’s – adding a layer of command confusion. The scenarios specify changes or exceptions to the standard rules and explain the game end and victory conditions. Some scenarios even let you "shift" your units between the parallel dimensions, adding a simulated 3D experience!

The game adds fresh ideas while incorporating familiar wargame concepts such as zone of control, supporting fire, attacker losses, and advances after combat, tucking them into the mechanisms in subtle ways that make it easy for novice players to understand.

You’ll need to print and cut 2 map sections, 10 unit standees, and (optionally) 10 Turn Tokens. The components come in two sizes, and you’ll only need to print one or two pages depending on the size you prefer. You’ll also need a regular deck of playing cards or a handful of six-sided dice.

—description from the designer

Name: Days of Daniel
Description:
An exciting way to learn fascinating facts about Daniel's life.

Explore the amazing life of Daniel, his dangers, his visions and his victories, as you play Days of Daniel - the board game with a difference!

Aims of the game:
Begin on the starting stone and move clockwise around the board, progressing from the outer to the inner circle, collecting the picture cards as you go and swapping pieces, when allowed, until your game card is complete.  You then have access to climb the final steps to the "end of Days".  The first person to arrive there with a complete game card is the winner.

—description from the box

Name: Leros: November 1943
Description:
Leros covers the German air attack and amphibious invasion of this Aegean island.

It comes with the usual Perry Moore photocopied map and 473 uncut counters. Units are platoon level. The rulebook is 20 pages and there is also a five-page "study folder" for the battle/

Name: Valiant & Villainy
Description:
Valiant & Villainy is a card game in which players take on a superhero or super villain that is defined by drawing random cards from the origin deck, the offensive power set deck, the defensive power set deck, and the utility power set deck. There are over 80k different possible combinations, so every game you play, your heroes and villains are different.

Throughout the course of the game, each player uses the same action deck that triggers super powers. They can use the powers to capture an objective or fight directly against the enemy.

Valiant & Villainy is both a co-operative and a competitive game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Link 'Em
Description:
A Link ‘Em is a riddle that contains two clues, the answers to which share a common word in the middle. What do you get when Leonardo da Vinci's Most Famous Painting meets Bart's Sax-playing Sister? The answer? MONA LISA SIMPSON. What do you get when A Toy Spud meets A Dandruff Shampoo?  MR. POTATO HEAD & SHOULDERS! Listen to a "this meets that" riddle and try to Link them correctly to win. It's pop culture candy for your brain!

—description from the publisher

Name: Garden Rummy
Description:
Garden Rummy uses the 64 Seed Packet Cards from The Garden Game to give a new twist to an old favourite.

There are 4 suits (Wild Garden, Flower Garden, Fruit Garden and Kitchen Garden) of 16 cards each. Each player is dealt 7 cards. The object of the game is to Go Out by putting all your cards down, either in sequences or in suitable discards. You may add cards to your opponent's sequences, but only when you go out (and the card you add will count to your opponent's score)

Triples of a single number do not count as sequences.

The number 16 card is special, in that you can discard a 16 with 1 or 2 more hidden cards beneath it, thus ridding your hand of unwanted cards without having to give them to your opponent. You may only pick up a 16 if you hold the 14 and 15 of the same suit to form a sequence immediately. Before picking up the 16, you must say whether you wish to have the concealed cards under it, sight unseen.

Scoring: 
100 points for going out. 50 points for each sequence. 10 pts/card in sequences of 3,4 or 5 cards. 20 pts/card for sequences of 6 or over.
Sequences containing a 16 double in value.
A complete suit of 16 cards doubles again.

—user summary

Name: Monster Clans
Description:
Monster Clans is a card game for children where you chose a monster (Dracula, the Werewolf, Frankenstein or the Mummy) and try to defeat other players using zombies and megacriatures.

To defeat your oponent and win the game you have to make the enemy's life total 0 or less. To acomplish that you should play your monster cards that have different habilities and effects depending their position in the table and the monsters they've nearby.

—user summary

Name: Necromunda: Underhive – Van Saar Gang Cards
Description:
Necromunda: Underhive contains a number of Tactics cards, which can be used to represent the myriad tricks and schemes employed by the gangs. Expand your games of Necromunda: Underhive – whichever gang you play – with this set of 26 extra cards. Included:


     12 Van Saar Tactics cards, which are for the exclusive use of the Van Saar gang;
     8 Gang Tactics cards, which can be used by any gang in Necromunda: Underhive;
     6 blank Fighter cards – perfect for the Champions and Leaders in your gang deck, these have been stamped with the House Van Saar crest.


—description from the publisher

Name: Arcadia Quest: Riders – Mount Pack 2: Samson & Baron
Description:
This is a set of two additional mounts for Arcadia Quest: Riders along with their rule cards.

The set was available as an optional purchase during the Arcadia Quest: Riders Kickstarter campaign, and is also available during Arcadia Quest: Riders official game nights at retail stores.

Name: Master of Wills: Cloudecho Expansion Faction Deck
Description:
Edgehunter brings new elemental powers to the game. Cast out from society they are forced to wander the wastelands looking to survive. When all hope seems lost, they stumble upon a lost artifact that imbues the survivors with elemental powers long forgotten. These new magical abilities cause these outcasts to ban together forming the faction of Edgehunter. With these new powers they will fight for their rightful place.

The world of chaos has bled over into all streams of life. Influence continues to shift from Faction to Faction with no end in sight. New powers have emerged that are shared between all Factions but how they are used is yet to be determined. Combining these technologies with their elemental powers, Edgehunters cans trike and take back their place in the world.

—description from the publisher

Name: Arcane Bakery Clash: Mystery Ingredients
Description:
The Arcane Bakery received a package of 3 new recipes using ingredients we haven't seen before.  For some added bite, try the Sharkuterie! For a suprise, try the Pinata Bomb! And if you are watching what  you eat, maybe you'll want the Omen Biscotti!

Components:
1 Pinata Bomb recipe card
1 Sharkuterie recipe card
1 Omen Biscotti recipe card

How to Play:
Add one, two, or all 3 of these new cards to your games.

Name: Drinkill
Description:
It’s time to get drunk! Drinkill is a drinking board game that will make each game become a night you’ll surely remember, and a day you’d rather forget.
How do you win? The only objective is to make it to the end. The first player that arrives to the “Vomit Here” space at the end of the board is the winner.
How do you lose? If you’re not the first player that arrives in the last space. You can also lose if you refuse to do a challenge but also refuse to take a shot. You can always surrender and admit defeat. 
The Drinkill game consists of 10 different characters. Each character has a special ability that can be used only once in every game. Before the game starts, each player chooses a character and draws 3 item cards from the deck. All players roll a pair of dice – the player with the higher number goes first and the other turns go clockwise.
On each turn, the player rolls a pair of dice and advances the number of spaces the dice say – when landing on a space – the player must do what the space indicates.
If it’s your turn, you can activate any card in your hand. If it’s not your turn, you can activate any card that is marked with a star.


What type of cards can you draw in this game?
Item cards: Items can be used to give the user an advantage in the game. Attack your opponents or delay them, defend yourself from other opponents and many other functions to make you win the race.

Challenge cards: Challenges are the core of the Drinkill game. When a player lands on challenge space he has to draw a card from the deck and decide whether to complete the challenge or to take a shot.

STD cards: STD cards are challenge cards that the player can hold in his hand like item cards and use them against other opponents.

Each player can hold up to 5 item cards at any given time and any amount of STD cards. Challenge cards are immediately discarded. Item and STD cards are discarded after use.


The Drinkill board spaces and what you have to do when you land on each of them:
1.    Burning shot – Take a shot.
2.    Totem – Draw an item card from the deck.
3.    Challenge – Draw a challenge card from the deck. You can decide to do the challenge or take a shot instead.
4.    STD – Draw an STD card from the deck.
5.    Pub – Choose another player to take a shot with, take a picture and upload it.
6.    Hospital – You’re stuck there and lose your next turn.
7.    Arrow space – Go forward/backward depending on the number on the arrow space.
8.    Golden coin – If you have the “Capitalist Pig” item card and you land on this space you can choose as many opponents as you want and discard all of their item cards.


Invite your friends, race them to the end and do a lot of stupid challenges while you’re getting drunk. Use cards combos and collaborate with other players to delay the leading opponent.

Do you think you’re hardcore? Do you want to make your friends wash the dishes? Do you want to make someone drink all the leftovers of the party? Do you want to kiss a beautiful girl but you’re the ugliest dude around? Now you can.

Name: Arcane Bakery Clash: Boss Bake-Off
Description:
A 3-Card Solo Expansion for Arcane Bakery Clash.

SETUP
Select a Gaius card and place it face up. Take the other two cards and play them face down, tucked under Gaius in any configuration you like.

Remove the Cheesequake card. Shuffle the remaining recipe cards and remove a number of cards based on the left boss card. They will not be used.

HOW TO PLAY
Play using the standard game rules, adding any rules listed under Curse.
After your turn, Gaius will take a turn.  Roll the die and if the number matches one of the Gaius' actions, take the action.
If Gaius is reduced to 0 energy, you win!  If you are reduced to 0 energy, Gaius wins!

Name: Stew: Fungus Among Us
Description:
Legend has it that if you cook with mushrooms, you might get visited by a gnome!  Don't mistake this for good luck, as it's quite the opposite when your bellas start to go missing.

Components:
4 Bella Ingredient Cards
1 Mutant Ingredient Card
1 Gnome Vermin Card

Gameplay:
Add these new cards to your games of Stew to mix things up.


Released in the April 2018 Board Game of the Month Club $20+ package.

Name: Ahead in the Clouds: Extra Player Pack
Description:
Contents:
1 Green or Yellow Player Habitat
4 Resource Cards
1 Contract Add-On

Setup:
To add an extra player to the game, simply choose your Contract Card and add the 3/4 player Contract Add-On.  If you have two Extra Player Packs you will use the 3 and 4 player sides, but if you are using just a single Extra Player Pack, you will tuck the 4 player side underneath your current Contract Card.

Name: Lest We Forget
Description:
Lest We Forget is a solitaire ground combat game for the 20th century and modern time. You lead a small group of no name soldiers to fight in a brief moment of a large battle. A game of LWF portraits what is happening within a single hex of many other wargames. The design goal of LWF is a quick and light wargame with high replay value which requires minimal setup time. The basic game features a typical land engagement. There are additional scenarios and army rules for historical periods to provide an enhanced immersion.

—description from the designer

Name: Tuscany & Euphoria Crossover Structures
Description:
The Euphoria crossover promo deck is cards that all have a negative passive effect, but they also all have a useful residual effect that triggers at the end of every year. You build them for yourself just like any other structure. Whether the negative is worth the positive effect depends on your strategy for the game.

Never released separately

Name: Un Gioco d'Ombre
Description:
Un Gioco d’Ombre ("A Game of Shadows") is a 2-4 players card game in which you will take the part of one of the 4 archetypes of pure evil (the Devil, the Orc, the Ghost and the Boogey Man) in an attempt to conquer young and innocent souls before your opponents do. To achieve this you will have at your disposal every evil and corrupt tool ever made like rock music, fantasy novels or card games (like this one). Terrible, isn’t?

The goal of the game is to be the first player to collect 20 young, innocent souls, or points. In each turn the player can do three actions chosen among drawing cards from the deck or playing the ones in their hand, in any order. A little twist is that players are allowed to anticipate one or more of their actions in another player's turn, in order to prevent them from scoring points.

Name: Guilty!: A Shamefully Fun Card Game
Description:
Guilty! is a cutthroat game of cunning, manipulation, and deceit for 3-6 adult players.  You probably want to keep children at least 500 feet away from this game at all times.

Each player acts as the Public Defender to one of 6 deplorable suspects being held in connection to a crime they most likely committed.

It is your duty to manipulate the system at all costs to make sure that your suspect is not found guilty by playing evidence cards like "Brown Eyes", "Fat", or "Mole on Face" and then debunk those pieces of evidence with cards like “Intimidate a Witness", "Flush the Drugs", or "Did You Just Assume My Gender?”

Once you have pinned enough evidence on your opponents, they are found guilty and they lose.

There is no winner in Guilty, only a loser. And no one likes a loser.

So, if you’ve ever wanted to bribe a cop, claim oppression, impersonate an officer or claim conspiracy in the comfort of your own home, Guilty! Is the game for you!

Name: Hellboy: The Board Game – Darkness Calls
Description:
Hellboy: The Board Game – Darkness Calls adds gameplay elements from the "Darkness Calls" storyline in the Hellboy comic series to Hellboy: The Board Game. This expansion consists of:


     1 hero miniature (Henry Hood)
     1 backup agent miniature
     1 boss miniature (Koschei the Deathless)
     2 mini boss miniatures
     15 undead minion miniatures
     1 agent card
     1 backup agent card
     Case file deck
     Encounter deck
     Requisition deck
     Deck of doom!
     Enemy deck
     Game tiles

Name: Hellboy: The Board Game – Hellboy In Mexico
Description:
Hellboy: The Board Game – In Mexico is an expansion that adds gameplay elements from the "Hellboy in Mexico" storyline to Hellboy: The Board Game. This expansion consists of:


     4 hero miniatures (Luchador Hellboy & 3 Luchadors)
     1 boss miniature (Camazotz)
     15 minion miniatures (5 types)
     4 agent cards
     Case file deck
     Encounter deck
     Requisition deck
     Deck of doom!
     Enemy deck
     Game tiles

Name: Liikennepeli
Description:
Liikennepeli is a kids’ game similar to Old maid but with a twist. The deck consists of six groups of four cards plus a ”Fines” card. The cards depict traffic signs and the game teaches their meanings. (The back of the box actually suggests to play Old Maid with this deck, using the 'fine' card as Old Maid.)

All cards are dealt to the players and players take turns drawing cards from their leftmost neighbor. If a player gets a full set of four cards, he/she places them face up and another player explains the meaning of the traffic signs one by one. If he/she succeeds the cards are set aside and the game continues, otherwise the set of four cards is dealt back to the players. The player with the Fines card at the end of the game loses.

Name: Yōkai: City of Crime
Description:
2089. Twelve years after the biggest technological advance in the whole of history, it was supposed to be a bright new era of prosperity… but that didn’t happen. The world is broken. The quantum leap forwards opened a gaping chasm between the rich and poor, and no one can feel safe anymore. People live in fear of tomorrow… and I am the one who wants to bring about what they fear. Welcome to YÅkai. The ever-shifting sprawl of vice and corruption. Your goal is to become the most powerful villain in the City of Crime.

YÅkai: City of Crime is a simple, dynamic game (it takes only 30-45 minutes to play, even with five players) with a large dose of negative interaction. The simplicity of the rules combined with a multitude of choices, not to mention the beautiful artwork, make this a game that will be returning to your table often.

In the game YÅkai: City of Crime, players take on the roles of powerful gangsters. Every round each player secretly chooses 2 actions which are executed in order of players’ reputation, so that those in the lead have the disadvantage of having to act before they know the full extent of their enemies’ plans.

During their turns, players can move through the different city districts, making use of location-specific abilities or simply causing mayhem; tipping off the police about their opponents’ activities or playing intrigue cards which leverage their underworld connections to thwart their rivals’ plans.

Each round, after the players have completed their actions, the police will raid the district with the most crime and tip-offs in an attempt to round up those responsible. Going to prison will slow down your ascent to the top, but it can help you make some useful connections. At the end of each round, the players who managed to evade the long arm of the law score reputation points based on the level of crime in their districts.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sword & Sorcery: Hero Pack – Kroghan the Barbarian/Dreadlord
Description:
The world of Sword & Sorcery always needs new heroes! With this Hero Pack, you now have the possibility to introduce a new, powerful character into your campaign.

Great men are forged by the harsh climate of the Northern Lands, where strength means survival or death. From these cold mountains, a powerful hero rises to crush evil foes... Kroghan, the fiercest warrior of his Clan! Kroghan can be played as either a Barbarian or a Dreadlord.

As a Barbarian, Kroghan is an example of extreme courage, a champion who gathers heroes under his guidance and leads them into battle!

As a Dreadlord, Kroghan is a cold-blooded and remorseless warrior, a dreadful champion - his enemies whisper his name in fear, and terror strikes their hearts when they meet him on the battlefield.

This Hero Pack features two miniatures of Kroghan (normal and Ghost Soul form), his Soul Gem, and new cards - including legendary treasures such as the creepy Bone Armor, the versatile Snowtroll Tooth artifact, and the deadly Bloodstone!

—description from the publisher

Name: BarBEARian Battlegrounds: Hammer Time Promo Card
Description:
This promo is a new upgrade card for the game BarBEARians.

This upgrade card costs 2 food, 1 faith, and 1 ore. It's ability is: "You may place dice of any value on your forge (not just 4, 5, or 6)"

The card is numbered UP-06.

This promo was distributed in Game Trade Magazine #221 (July 2018).

Name: Trucking Hell
Description:
Trucking Hell is a pick-up-and-deliver game. Deliver objects of various types to cities that may be asking for animals, furniture, toiletries, food, etc. The things you pick up are actually Wibbell++ cards, which you then use to spell out the things that you are delivering! Thus, this game challenges both your spelling ability and your route-planning.

It's the first in a series of games that will contain a mini-Wibbell++ deck as one of the components.

Name: Being Erica: The Game
Description:
This game is based on the Canadian television show, 'Being Erica' (which aired from 2009-2011).

The object of the game is to be the first player to move your pawn around the board and back to the start space.

Depending on which space you are on, you might have to share regrets, give advice on how to deal with regrets, vote on other players' advice, etc. "Erica's Regrets" cards will help fuel the conversation. Depending on the answers you provide and the spaces you land on, you may be able to advance on the board faster than any other player. The player who advances the fastest will be the winner.

Name: Timestamp
Description:
Time travel is an unpredictable and unforgiving science.  One wrong move can have catastrophic effects, potentially tearing apart the very fabric of the universe. To prevent such accidents, the secrets of time travel have been hidden in clues spread across the world by some mysterious entity. Your team of scientists is on the brink of unlocking these clues. With a nearly functional device, you prepare to embark on humanity's greatest journey. However you are not the only team to do so...

Timestamp is an episodic adventure game in which two players face off to unlock the mysteries of time travel for the human race. Each postcard installment takes players to new times and locations with unique challenges and goals. Every game will be different as players manage their teams of scientists and resources to perform one of the four actions unique to each card. The first player to meet the scenarios goal wins. Follow the clues, master your device, and unlock time itself!

—description from the publisher


A mysterious device has the potential to change the future. And the past. Across 12 episodes by 4 designers, you will unlock the mysteries of time travel, change history, and hopefully save the future.

Each episode brings a new twist on a central mechanism, as 2 teams of scientists compete to learn more about the device, research events on the timeline, and hunt for key components that will allow them mastery over time. Each episode occurs in a different time and place, from Elizabethan England to earth’s Lunar Colony, so you never know exactly where you’ll end up next.

TimeStamp is the 2018 Board Game of the Month postcard from Button Shy, with each month bringing a new episode, which can be played independently.

—description from the designer


Episodes:

     01 – 2020: Santa Colina (Prologue)
     02 – 1955: Santa Colina
     03 – 2020: Undisclosed location, UT
     04 – 1912: Southampton
     05 – 2076: Moon Base Adam
     06 – 2009: Cambridge
     07 – 1888: Range Creek, UT
     08 – ????: Middle of Nowhen
     09 – 1593: Cambridge
     10 – 1947: Roswell, NM
     11 – 2045: Geneva
     12 – 2020: Santa Colina (End)

Name: Apocrypha Adventure Card Game: Box Two – The Flesh
Description:
THE FLESH IS WILLING.

Rotting creatures pouring out from an oil well. Faeries on motorcycles and carnival rides. Flying drones marshalled by a monster made of clay and wires. Flesh-eating bacteria worming its way into your nervous system. Just another day on the edge of the apocalypse.

The Flesh is an expansion for the Apocrypha Adventure Card Game that can be played as a co-op card game for 1-6 players or a full roleplaying game with one player acting as a guide.

The Flesh contains four chapters, each containing cards that detail memories written by a legendary author. This box contains:

     The Book of the Deathless, in which an oil town in frozen Alberta is invaded by the risen dead, with memories by Bruce R. Cordell.
     The Book of the Fae, in which the faeries and bikers of the Wild Hunt roar across the American Midwest, with memories by Jerry “Tycho” Holkins.
     The Book of the Golems, in which the tech hub of Seattle is overrun with drones and robots, with memories by Teeuwynn Woodruff.
     The Book of the Physicians, in which the eastern seaboard is the test market for virulent designer diseases, with memories by Kris Straub.


—description from the publisher

Name: Apocrypha Adventure Card Game: Box Three – The Devil
Description:
GIVE THE DEVIL ITS DUE.

Angels and demons colluding in the bright casino lights. Animals and plants coiling around us in the night. Strange outsiders entering the world through your dreams. Snake cultists seeking to raise a dragon from an Aztec pyramid. All these and more come together for a highly unsettling apocalypse.

The Devil is an expansion for the Apocrypha Adventure Card Game that can be played as a co-op card game for 1-6 players or a full roleplaying game with one player acting as a guide.

The Devil contains four chapters, each containing cards that detail memories written by a legendary author. This box contains:

     The Book of the Animus, in which the New Orleans bayou is threatened by the great spirit of nature, with memories by Kij Johnson.
     The Book of the Damned, in which Las Vegas is overrun with demons and angels preying on the weak-willed tourists, with memories by Erin M. Evans.
     The Book of the Dreamers, in which the cities of New England are invaded by twisted nightmares, with memories by Keith Baker.
     The Book of the Serpents, in which the ancient ruins of Mexico are unearthed by snake worshippers searching for the last dragon, with memories by Wolfgang Baur.


—description from the publisher

Name: Auf die 6 kommt's an!
Description:
Each player uses 3 neighboring columns on the game board. The spaces in each column are numbered 1 to 4. The big center space has the number 5. Each turn the player rolls a die and sets one token on a space of the rolled number. If a 6 is rolled, the player may chose one column. For each placed token, the player gets as many points as the space it has been placed on indicates.
If all 3 spaces of a number are occupied, they count double. The tokens get stacked, ifa number is rolled more thn 3 times.

After 6 turns the players roll the die till a 6 is rolled. The player who rolled the 6 gets 5 points for each token on space 5. The player who has the most points after 6 rounds wins the game.

Name: Apocrypha Adventure Card Game: The Book of the Hybrids
Description:
The Book of the Hybrids is a special eleventh chapter of the Apocrypha Adventure Card Game.

It's composed of nine missions, each of which uses two chapters. You'll need the boxes containing both chapters to play each mission.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Believer Box of Bad Advice
Description:
A card game of horrible advice from your favorite comedians. Featuring David Cross, Amy Sedaris, Zach Galifianakis, Louis C.K., Judd Apatow, Dave Eggers, Mindy Kaling, Michael Cera, Ed Helms, Janeane Garofalo, Fred Armisen, and more.

Players are dealt five answer cards, and the dealer reads aloud one question card to the group. Players submit their funniest answer card to the dealer. The most mixed-up, messed-up advice (judged by the dealer) wins the round. Dealer duty passes from player to player until one player wins a fourth round. The first player to win four rounds wins the game.

Topics range from political to existential to mature, and more.

Name: Trailmazer
Description: Trailmazer is a fast-paced, strategy game in which players take turns rolling their rings onto the game board. The first player to connect one side of the board to the opposite side with a criss-crossed line in their own color wins!

Name: News@11
Description:
Make up stories, and break the news!

News@11 is a cyclical storytelling game for 4 to 11 news anchors who are ready to fill in cue cards and incorporate the topics on them into their segment as they build the story. Stories from the morning news come back in the afternoon and evening, getting stranger and more tangled each time.

No points, no scoring — just a hilarious time telling the news! Lights, camera, you're on in 3, 2, 1...

Name: Ghost Fightin' Treasure Hunters: Creepy Cellar Expansion
Description:
The dark and dreary house is taken over by ghosts yet again, but this time the rules have changed. The Ghost King has arrived! The front doors locked the moment you entered, and the only way to open them is to take the treasures down to the cellar rooms before escaping the house. Do this and get the whole team out of the house before all eight hauntings are on the board!

The Creepy Cellar Expansion adds the following items to the award-winning cooperative gameplay of Ghost Fightin' Treasure Hunters:


    An expanded game board with two new rooms and a new win condition.
    Twelve cursed treasures that inflict dangerous disabilities as long as you hold them.
    The King Ghost — a terrible blue ghost who roams the house and can never be defeated.
    Secret passages, trap doors, jinxed items, and more!

Name: Thunderstone Quest: Barricades Mode
Description:
Barricades Mode, an expansion for Thunderstone Quest, lets you play a solo or co-operative adventure against the toughest Guardians in the game.

Thunderstone Quest is a deckbuilding game where 2-4 players (or 1-6 players in Barricades Mode) compete to see who can score the most victory points when the game ends. In deckbuilding games your objective is to try to assemble the best possible deck to achieve the play strategy you prefer based on the options that are assembled for each game, and the random challenges you'll need to overcome.

Each player's deck represents a party of stalwart adventurers who will face and defeat the challenges of the Dungeon and will return to the Village to recover and re-equip.

On each turn you use your deck to generate a hand of cards, and you take actions based on the cards you drew. Sometimes you'll be in the Village buying new cards and using your resources. Sometimes you'll be in the Dungeon fighting monsters. And sometimes you'll do a little bit of both!

In Thunderstone Quest you'll be playing an adventure which is comprised of a set of Dungeon tiles and a selection of monsters, treasures, and challenges that are themed to that Dungeon. You'll get the sense of a dramatic campaign as you grow stronger and finally confront the Guardian.

Depending on which cards you buy and which adversaries you defeat you will earn victory points. After the Guardian encounter is over, the player with the most victory points is the winner!

The competitive mode is designed for 2 to 4 people (up to 6 people with To The Barricades content!) to play and it takes about 90 minutes to complete an Adventure. Barricades mode is designed for 1 to 6 people to play and will also take about 90 minutes to complete an Adventure.

Name: Thunderstone Quest: What Lies Beneath
Description:
This is Quest #6 for Thunderstone Quest, first made available through the Thunderstone Quest: Back to the Dungeon Kickstarter campaign.

What Lies Beneath, the sixth quest for Thunderstone Quest, which presents a story-driven scenario for the attack on the village, can be played in normal competitive mode as well as in Barricade mode. This expansion includes more than 240 cards, six dungeon tiles, and a rulebook.

Name: Shh! Bocadillos de medianoche
Description:
The night has fallen, all humans are off to sleep, and the racoons seize the darkness to get inside their kitchen and steal delicious snacks to take back to their lair. But, be careful! The family dog sleeps in the kitchen and will bark immediately if it discovers thieves inside! So,Shhh! Don’t make any noises, for if the humans wake up, they’ll bring their brooms and you’ll have to run away empty handed.

Game Description
Shhhhh!!! Bocadillos de medianoche ("Shh! Midnight Snacks") is a fun and fast-paced, game in which players are represented by racoons that try to steal as much food as possible before the dog barks and wakes up the people inside the house.

Game Objective
The objective of the game is to be the player that collects the most amount of food points. This is achieved by moving food tokens from the kitchen to a nearby window, but the bigger the food looted, the noisier the racoons will be and chances are they might wake the dog up. If the dog is fully awakened, it will start barking and the residents of the house will wake up. The player that collects the most amount of food points will be the winner.

—description from the publisher

Name: Video Trivialities
Description:
The box contains one game board, eight pawns, a VHS cassette, and booklet with the rules and questions. After each player chooses a pawn, they roll the dice with the greatest number rolled getting a three space starting advantage on the game board and the role of video operator. The video operator poses the questions in the booklet and operates the remote for the VHS player.

To play, the video operator reads aloud the next question in the booklet. Each player offers an answer starting with the video operator and going clockwise. Players must offer a different guess than one already offered by a previous player or pass one’s turn. When everyone has made a guess or passed, then the video operator plays the VHS tape which reveals the proper response. If a player has given the correct answer then that player rolls the die and advances that many spaces on the game board toward the finish. The first player to reach in the finish is the winner.

The Video Trivialities game contains 258 questions. There is at least one expansion with a question booklet and another VHS cassette.

Name: Rat-Snake
Description:
Rat-Snake is a gambling game that requires two six-sided dice to play. Players will roll dice on a mat, wagering their ante in a silo for a payout. The game was created in the fictional universe of Lankhmar, played by characters in the game. It was made real and published by Goodman Games and sold through their website.

The game comes in a tube and includes six dice (although only a pair of dice are used per thrower.) Players take turns as the "Thrower" rolling dice. They pay a six coin ante, and roll the dice.
